Booleans: BOOLEAN: BER: as 1 byte in binary form; PER: as 1 bit; OER: as 1 byte
Integer: INTEGER: BER: variable-length big-endian binary representation (up to 2^(2^1024) bits); PER Unaligned: a fixed number of bits if the integer type has a finite range; a variable number of bits otherwise; PER Aligned: a fixed number of bits if the integer type has a finite range and the size of the range is less than 65536; a variable number of octets otherwise; OER: one  two  or four octets (either signed or unsigned) if the integer type has a finite range that fits in that number of octets; a variable number of octets otherwise
Floating-point: Multiple valid types (VisibleString  PrintableString  GeneralString  UniversalString  UTF8String)
String: data specifications SET OF (unordered) and SEQUENCE OF (guaranteed order)

Integer: big-endian 2's complement signed and unsigned 8/16/32/64 bits
Floating-point: single: big-endian binary32 double: big-endian binary64
String: UTF-8 encoded  null terminated  preceded by int8 or int32 string length in bytes
Array: Typecode (one byte) + 1-4 bytes size + 1-4 bytes items count + list items
Associative array/Object: Typecode (one byte) + 1-4 bytes size + 1-4 bytes items count + key/value pairs

String: Balanced brackets with an optional array count. Arrays can be nested.
Array: Balanced brackets with an optional object count. Objects can be nested.

Integer: int32: 32-bit little-endian 2's complement or int64: 64-bit little-endian 2's complement
String: UTF-8 encoded  preceded by int32 encoded string length in bytes
Array: BSON embedded document with numeric keys

Floating-point: Typecode with count (like integer coding) and items
String: Typecode with pairs count (like integer coding) and pairs

Null: xsi:nil element (1-4 bits depending on context)
Integer: 0–12 bits (log2 range) bits for integers with defined ranges less than 4096. Extensible sequence of octets with infinite range for larger or undefined ranges. Also supports custom representations.
Floating-point: Scalable floating point representation requiring 18 to 88 bits depending on magnitude. Also supports IEEE and custom representations.
String: Length prefixed sequence of Unicode code points with partitioned string tables for efficient representation of repeated items. The length and code points are represented as variable length unsigned integers where values under 128 require 1 octet each. Also supports custom representations.
Array: Repeated elements or length-prefixed list of values. Also supports custom representations.
Associative array/Object: Ordered (sequence) or unordered (all) group of named elements.

Null: Vector of any other type  preceded by its length (32 bit) and relative offset (32 bit) Fixed size array: int32[10] Dynamic vector: int32[] Linked list: int32() Set: int32!
Booleans: Vector of (key  value) pairs  preceded by its length (32 bit) and relative offset (32 bit) Ordered map: int32<string> Unordered hash table: int32{string}

Null: Encoded as absence of field in parent object
Integer: little-endian 2's complement signed and unsigned 8/16/32/64 bits
Floating-point: UTF-8 encoded  preceded by 32 bit integer length of string in bytes
String: Vectors of any other type  preceded by 32 bit integer length of number of elements
Array: Tables (schema defined types) or Vectors sorted by key (maps / dictionaries)

Floating-point: Typecode + up to 15 bytes or typecode + length as uint8/16/32 + bytes; encoding is unspecified[26]

Integer: UTF-8 encoded  preceded by varint-encoded integer length of string in bytes
Floating-point: Repeated value with the same tag
Length-prefixed "short" Strings (up to 64 bytes)  marker-terminated "long" Strings and (optional) back-references

Array: list of elements with identical ID and size  preceded by array header with int16 length
Associative array/Object: chunks can contain other chunks to arbitrary depth
